data.title: Apple Playing 'Poker Game' With China Production Move, Wedbush's Ives Says
data.text: Daniel Ives, Wedbush Securities managing director, discusses the Nikkei report that Apple Inc. has asked its largest suppliers to consider the costs of shifting 15% to 30% of its output from China to Southeast Asia. He speaks with Bloomberg's Emily Chang and Mark Gurman on "Bloomberg Technology."

data.title: Apple Analyst: Shift Away From Chinese Production Would Be 'Gargantuan Endeavor'
data.text: Nikkei Asian Review reported Wednesday that Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) is considering shifting 15% to 30% of its production capacity from China to elsewhere in Asia.

data.title: Apple Wants Suppliers to Explore Major Shift From China: Nikkei
data.text: Apple Inc. has asked its largest suppliers to consider the feasibility of shifting 15% to 30% of its output from China to Southeast Asia in a dramatic shake-up of its production chain, the Nikkei reported. Bloomberg Opinion columnist Alex Webb discusses the implications on "Bloomberg Surveillance." His views are his own.

data.title: Dow Outperforming in June: 5 of the Best Stocks in the ETF
data.text: The Dow Jones is on track to record its best June in 80 years, having gained nearly 7% so far this month.

data.title: Apple says iPhones can now be fixed at all U.S. Best Buy stores
data.text: Apple Inc and Best Buy Co Inc said on Wednesday that they have extended a partnership that will allow the Minneapolis-based retailer's technicians fix iPhones at any Best Buy store in the United States.

data.title: Apple's first 4 iOS apps for Mac are getting an upgrade. News needs it the most
data.text: Software chief Craig Federighi says last year's iOS apps for Mac will get a refresh that will arrive in the public beta of MacOS 10.15 Catalina.

data.text: Since 2001, Apple has staked its claim across the world with its own first-party brick and mortar locations.

data.title: Apple considers moving 15% to 30% of production capacity out of China: report
data.text: Apple Inc. AAPL, +0.02% is considering moving 15% to 30% of its production capacity from China to Southeast Asia, according to a report from the Nikkei Asian Review, which said that the company has asked its suppliers to look into the costs of such a move.

data.title: Nikkei: Apple Could Shift Some Production Capacity Out Of China
data.text: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) is considering shifting 15% to 30% of its output from China to Southeast Asia due to the trade war, according to Nikkei Asian Review reports.

data.title: Apple Stock Is Due Another Pullback, Which Is Your Chance to Buy
data.text: AAPL stock will return to double-digit growth, investors should buy if antitrust issues or temporary slowdowns again weigh on AAPL.

data.title: The iPod Touch 2019 is the cheapest way to get iOS 13 and Apple Arcade
data.text: What the latest iPod Touch lacks in screen and battery life, it makes up for in apps, games, AR and a headphone jack.

data.title: Apple explores moving 15-30% of production capacity from China: Nikkei
data.text: Apple Inc has asked its major suppliers to assess the cost implications of moving 15% to 30% of their production capacity from China to Southeast Asia as it prepares for a restructuring of its supply chain, according to a Nikkei Asian Review report on Wednesday.
